Review Title: Meh....sad to say, but over rated i think....
Review: I really wanted to go here after reading other reviews, but other than pose for some pictures and a nice walk.... not much is here. I guess if you have small children this is the place to go and let them play, but I was bored in 5 minutes. So I guess a mixed feeling.

We visit people’s park at around 1-2PM when we went inside the place is cool. We stayed for a while and let our son play in the playground its nice that they have this kind of place in Davao where people can just relax. And its nice that they maintained the place so clean.

Good for a morning or night walk but seems like the park has more to offer but not maintained well esp for the lights at night which I think they should have added more. Looks old and needs some upgrading. Though its for free, I believe because there's nothing to do there we haven't stayed for more than 20 mins. We just literally walk around to check it out.

Review Title: Small park but well maintained, clean
Review: This park is a great and secure place for people to walk and avoid the fumes of jeepneys in the streets of Davao. Smoking is not allowed inside and there is a checkpoint in the entrance wherein bringing cigarettes, lighters, tobacco (maybe vape as well) are strictly prohibited and enforced. Good place to jog in the morning or on sunset.
relax place. and picnic place. also nice place for exercise in morning. romantic place in evening for couples

This place had certainly seen much better times and should get back in focus from local authorities because it's a beauty in its core.  It is obvious that maintenance badly failed, many points of interest are not on function anymore, dirty and damaged. The nature is amazing and despite the bad condition many people love to go there for relaxing, chatting and energizing. But its a dying beauty and needs to be missed awake with great efforts.  You don't have so many places to go in Davao City , so better take care of the here before it falls totally apart.
Free to get in. Its a lovely park for the whole family to visit with friendly security. Its nice to go there during the day or at night.

Review Title: Good park just in the center of Davao City
Review: Nice park with lots of trees from all around the world, some animals/birds and even waterfall. Like a small oasis in the concrete jungle of Davao. Very peaceful place.  Good to go with friends, families and kids. Peoples park! Clean and tidy. Lots of people going there for sports activities like jogging or boxing classes. Good decorations for Christmas. Good to be there after busy streets.

The place is really good for hang-out with friends, picnic with family and time for your self if you need to get out for a noisy surroundings. Aside from that, you're all secured because this area is within Davao City and we all know how secured Davao City is.
This is a very nice family park with places to sit and socialize as well as many photo opportunities. It is free to get in and a very easy place to find.

Review Title: What a fun and peaceful part Of Davao
Review: If your visit brings you to Davao its a pretty peaceful part of life here at Peoples Park .  . Very enjoyable as you watch the children at play , adults doing yoga and dance exercise classes and special events are held here for various local groups .  Truly , Proples Park embodies the spirit and caring of the citizens of Davao.   Can walk or jog through the park which is heavily shaded with all local trees and a pretty koy pond to watch the fish . Various statues line the park which makes it a relaxing morning or afternoon . Admission is Free.  Thumbs up , very enjoyable.
its nice to see alot of people enjoy being in this park. you can see students and young people get together for a certain practise and nice to have witness them practise a choral song.
Walking with friend at the middle of the night with different lightning and police enforcer are all around the corner, so no worries with joy and laughter.

A very nice park in the heart of the city. You can go here to relax and just sit while enjoying the trees that provides fresh air. Very well maintained as you see people sweeping from time to time though they're somewhat rude because there was an instance they were sweeping my foot without even saying excuse. Nonetheless it was ok. It has Wifi too which is very fast.

Review Title: A Place or Get Frisked, Then Take a Relaxing Walk
Review: My wife is a Filipino and remembers going to this park before immigrating to the U.S. So, we went on our recent visit. Cops frisk you before you enter but they are cool about it. They are friendly. People jog there. It used to be an arboretum but the city let it go down hill. Now, it's just a nice place to take a walk. It has some of the largest city-type pigeons I ever saw strutting around the asphalt.

We went to peoples park out of curiosity amd i was quite surprised how peaceful it was. There were lots of people just milling around young and old alike not much to see but nice to spend time with the family, some nice structures and statues for photos and stuff. There is no entrance fee amd security is first class you are pated down on entry amd asked to leave lighters and matches at the entrance as there is a no smoking in public policy across the philippines. Oh its also disabled friendly . So if in Davao city go check it out just to take 5 from all the business of the city

Review Title: See locals and tourist in this man made lungs in the city
Review: Local and tourist flock here to escape the hustle and bustle of Davao City. You find couples dating, young and old joggers , families strolling . Must visit for tourist to catch a glimpse of local life.

- visited November 2017 (morning) - no entrance fee - more or less 1 hour is sufficient to explore this place - good place for jogging and brisk walking - well maintained - interesting to note the species of plants and trees around too
My family and i had a nice time walking around checking out the sculptures. My kids loved the giant eagle. If your in davao you should stop.

Review Title: Forest in the middle of the city
Review: Very safe place to run and exercise. Ambience is so relaxing because of the big trees. Also, there's so many entertaining sculptures for picture takings. People are friendly.

We arrived in Davao much earlier that the hotel's check-in time. So we left our stuff first at the hotel, then went straight to People's Park. We rode a jeep and went down Aldivinco area so we had to get a 'padyak' (bike) to bring...More

We love to see people happy.....we love to reach out.....no rich no poor, meeting in one place called "People's Park".....this is the place...... Safety is important, fear is not accepted....calmness is welcome......
The place us safe, clean and has lots of big trees that provide shade. Early morning walks are best, and perchance you will see the Zumba enthusiasts moving to the upbeat music. Location is great.
Nothing much to do here really. Maybe if you want to jog, or hang out with friends. But if you are a tourist with a hectic schedule, no need to put this in your must-sees

If you want to step out of the busy streets down town, this is one of the places to go. People's Park is where locals go for their morning/evening jog, since it actually has nice running tracks circling the park. When I visited the park there where plenty of people in the park, everything from joggers to families. Go here for some relaxation, bring some food and drinks and just enjoy.
This is safe for every one even at night or early morning for joggers. Good for families and large group of friends to have some picnics.
Peoples park, park that you can hang out whit your friends. Last night was so amazing we have a change to meet more new friends. Safe to hang out nice people and good security.
The park is clean and well maintained, perfect for jogging!!! You acn also bring you children to play.

We visited it during the Kadayawan Festival. I haven't been back here for a long time and I was really amazed with its transformation. Nature, culture, and people mixed harmoniusly. Colorful Kadayawan decorations, landmarks and many trees at the heart of the city. Till my next trip, see you again Davao!

Park is great for outdoor exercise and jogging and walking with many trees and garden areas Wonderful environment for relaxing and enjoying the outdoors in the middle of Davao Thumbs up great place to visit and enjoy the atmosphere and people of Davao

I would say that this is now my new favorite park. Located in the heart of the city, but once youre inside you wouldnt feel you are the city as it has lots of trees and the feel is much closer to nature.
It's incredible that this place is here in davao. So calm, so peaceful, with fresh air, lots of trees and strolling or walking around the place just makes me feel great.

If you are staying near the area and want a place to jog in the morning or just want to visit the park to unwind. The area is clean just be careful for pickpockets, yes the place is guarded but don't be so confident.

I went there late afternoon about 5.30 and people are coming there maybe from work and some are from school... It was a huge park ..i saw lots of people.doing thier exercise and and some students are making thier dance practice and drama practice.. Its...More
Its my first time visiting such a huge park. When you get there you can really see the Filipino culture. People with their families enjoying quality time together. And also theres lots of doves.

I'm not used to these kinds of places, I feel out of place in a good kind of way. I love pigeons but also I'm afraid of their poo. Lol, it feels relaxed here kids running around. Come to think think of it, it's a...More

I've always loved central park in new york, a place where I could jog, think and have picnics, somewhere in a city of stone and concrete a patch of green, hehe. And this is just like it. I'm not sure if they have it in...More

In the age of interest, kids often neglect these kinds of places, but man I love this place. Great place to just walk around and get your stuff back together. Also a good family place. Gotta love the local government for keeping this place tidy

It's amazing how any busy city would have a place like this for its residents,, calm and serene. I remember when my dad would bring us to places like this every Sunday morning, just brings back a lot of fun childhood memories!
The park was really clean, people were so deciplined, good place to unwind, you can still visit the place even if its a hot season since there's a lot of trees.
it's just a plain park with nothing much in it. But i think you can still try to visit if this is on the way or you are near the location since this is the main park of Davao City.

As I walked around this park I had noticed it was a bit tired so many features of the past not working or just run down the heat of the day was eased by the old trees of which gave a lot of shade which...More

some 20+ years ago, this used to be an empty, boring PTA oval. wow, i am impressed with the transformation. i love the colorful statues that depicts davao culture. i like the fact that they maintained the track field for anyone who would like to...More
Lovely park with picturesque views, very instagrammable, secure, good place to jog..don't forget to bring your camera especially for first timers like me, i would definitely go back to this place..

this park located right at the back of the Apo View Hotel and right across Casa Leticia, the People's Park is a breather from the concrete jungle. This park used to be an empty sports arena, in the 70's we used to jog around the...More
We enjoyed our visit but the kids had a wonderful time running and playing in the park. This is designed for kids and family. Very nice to see.
The place is very dirty the garden they offer is a mess and the garden near the lagon smells so disgusting smells pee!!! My visitors was so disappointed and went directly to exit. Bad city park.

Brought my best friend here during our 2 day vacation in Davao. Security is high, and cleanliness is very well. Lots of trees and flower around. Also lots of interesting statues around this park. We enjoyed taking photos around here. It is also near the...More

Review Title: If you want to get fit
Review: If you want to get fit, you may opt for a jog at this place. You can also leave your kids playing at the playground while you dont have to worry about them as the whole place is closely guarded.

I was here with few friends and we had great time taking pictures around the place. Its quite good and in between the city. Love those statues that they have inside the park and the fountain which was not working in the afternoon when i...More
This is the place to be if you want to get a feel of local culture and meet some locals. I loved the cement sculptures by Kublai Millan, the trees, and the droves of pigeons flying from tree to tree.

Review Title: Relaxing place found at the heart of the city
Review: If you want to get relaxed and you're in the city, this is the best place to go to. You can usually meet locals here and even tourists. The park is filled with statues designed by a famous artist, benches, and trees/plants. There are also...More

Review Title: A GOOD PLACE TO DO JOGGING
Review: If you are a tourist in Davao City and you want a place to jog, then People's Park is the place. Before this place became a park, it was a track oval where most local athletes did their practice. When it was developed into a...More
Get to see and meet locals and enjoy all the different things to see. Very enjoyable and will visit again.
This site is really good for young and old ones. Taking breath easily away from dusty roads. solemn place for dating, walking exercise and play like no other fun.
This park is good for jogging or just chillin with your love ones. The park is very clean and has a lot of greens.
Nice little park in the middle of downtown, could be bigger. Good to walk - stroll around. Nice plants could use grass

People's Park in the heart of Davao is a nice park white grass or benches to sit down and just look at the life around you or have a picnic. There are a lot of nice flowers and trees in combination whit rounds and wather....More
Visit in the cool of the afternoon. Have a stroll then get a seat and let the city come to you. Great people watching
Nothing to see her except a few koi carp swimming around in a small pool.No fountain working. Just looks like an overgrown garden.

You'll find plenty of people exercising around the around, a lot of statues (durian, eagle, etc) so it's a fun photo taking opportunity. But most of all, it's relaxing. Just take a seat at a bench and just enjoy the trees and doves flying about....More

The place is really relaxing and the flock of pigeons inside the park are amusing! At the exit of the park, you'd find a pasalubong center where we scored inexpensive items like bags, purses, and key chains.
Is a nice place.However,there is a bamboo shack by the restroom as yiu enter straight forward and the bottom is rotten so kind of danger to fall. Sane the roof doesn't seam great.

We went to People's Park for a walk with our Little Jeya. She was as excited like us since it would be her first time in the People's Park, only to be disappointed. One of the vendors told us dogs were not allowed inside. We...More
This place is great for biking, group dancing, or choreographing a dance for a class project, and for just chilling out.

I have been many times in the late evening. It is always clean and I certainly feel safe there. Officers are always on duty. Visited by families and young couples. NIce place to relax. I say it reflects culture because you can see the Filipino...More
Most suitable for jogging,playing and amusement place in Davao.Many groups visiting the Park in the mornng and evening time. Nice to go with family for a joy & more activities.
i went there during the christmas period most of the trees had lights on ,it looked very nice ,it was easy to find and many places to eat nearby
Near by the hotel Galleria, very nice to walk arround and relacse. I recommend a vissit to the park :-)

We always come to have a picnic during the weekdays to avoid busy and crowded weekends. It is close to the hotel were I stayed. I love the park coz it's huge and clean. Well maintained. Lots of attractions to see and nice views for...More

This park is near the ampitheater with a durian roof, there was also a big eagle there and lots of policemen and soldiers as there will be a Chinese New Year program during our visit. It is a cool place to relax and have a...More
I do jog here once in a while and well it is indeed clean plus there are lots of trees that it makes the air fresh.
Everytime I want to get relax and smell some fresh air, I go to here and I also do jog sometimes here
A nice place to bring family and friends. the place is clean and strictly no smoking which is good for everyone. Secured, bags are checked before entering the premises.

I visited the park in the evening and surprisingly I saw many city folks enjoying jogging, dancing zumba, students practicing their dance presentation, and others strolling around with their friends or families. Some of the facilities needs repair including lighting.

Review Title: just a quick visit to break up the day and relax for a couple of hours
Review: nice a peaceful very clean .....the tress around the grounds make a perfect sun shade was a nice place to relax
Park is located near downtown very clean and well-kept beautiful landscaping and flowers it's free to the public the early morning or late in the evening to avoid the Heat

I was quite dismayed visiting the park this month because all the fun and entertaining big statues were removed from the area. The pirates, penguins, hollywood stars, dinosaurs, and others are all gone! But at least the pigeons are still around. The usual fitness buff...More

Formerly the once popular PTA Grounds in Davao City, this P72 M worth People’s Park opened on December 15, 2007 which features a mini-forest, interactive fountains, waterfalls and ponds, a kid’s toyland and large sculptures representing indigenous groups in Southern Mindanao and the Philippine eagle....More

This place is just another park so good to sit and relax amidst the busy city of Davao but there is no exciting part that you will find or any other exciting adventure that awaits here. The place is good for children who likes to...More

I used to go to this place in the evenings just to relax and to chill. Nice place to kill the time. Some days there are water dance shows, which is beautiful. You can find some nice street food right next to the park in the streets.

The park guys were kind enough to let us in due to their Tourist-priority friendly. Their are a lot of pigeons and are very used to people around. It's very relaxing to chill around during noon-time with all their trees providing shade and cool winds.
nice place to visit. you will have plenty of time here to relax and gaze the beauty of the view. Clean and lovely.

People's park is located in the center of the city. It is in walking distance with Apo View Hotel, Sampaguita Inn, Tsuru, TAPS and a whole lot more hotels, restaurants, inn and mall. How to go there: From the airport, take a cab ride and ask the driver to take you to people's park. What is in there? This is a park for kids, thus there are rides for the kids and sometimes it features different paintings in the dome. It is also famous for Mang Danny's ice cream.
If you are in Davao city, you need to stop by at People's Park, just to relax or to walk around. It's breath taking view inside the park will be relaxing.

The best part: FREE!!! You can take pictures of giant statues inside the park. Ranging from Cartoons, to game superheroes to movie characters. You can also enjoy the nature since there's a lot of trees and birds on the park.

We went in the morning so I cannot comment on an evening visit. Peoples Park is within walking distance from our hotel but could be reached using a trike. Many photo opportunities within the park. Near Pasalubong Center

Nice place to relax, jog, walk, spend your free time, get some fresh air, etc.  Pros? Free, no entrance fee Cons? Not properly maintained, CR, fountain, etc.  It would be nice if we could bring our pets here (even if we would clean our pet's wastes)

Review Title: For the People, By the People
Review: An enclosed free public park of Davao City. Medium sized park which showcases various statues made by a local artist. This is the fave hang out place of locals for family and friend bondings
A cultural theme park where you can enter for free. When we went there it was under renovation. Nothing much you can see just the huge People's Park signage.
You can stay in the park the whole day surfing the net or if you are a pokemon fanatic, there are pokemon everywhere.

Review Title: top free park in davao city
Review: i was looking forward to coming back to this park from our visit 4 years ago as we were really impressed with this public park. it was just a few minutes walk from our inn so we went there night time..i noted new structures being...More

Review Title: one of the great parks in the city
Review: located along palma gil. there's a nearby 7-11 convenience store and pasalubong center. went there aug19 6am and there was an ongoing zumba exercise. almost 100 davaoenos are participating. lots of locals and tourists are there as well. there are pigeons which you can feed...More

I have known People's park for so long. I have done jogging session several times in the past. This was also the venue for a field trip with the sixth grader class of my daughter. The view and the sculpture are excellent. Last night I...More
its a good place to have a morning walk. you may also join the people doing their exercises with music. the place is clean and safe

Review Title: Not everyday to see a DURIAN roof, Trees and Shades, Arts and Nature..
Review: Best place to unwind, meet new friends, lots of trees and shades, perfect for strolling and family bonding...
Nice place for jogging and walking and meet up with friends and play games. 😄uhmm it's nice to go a dance practice in the big place there. Good for picnics also.

Went there a little late after 8am with the fam. It's closing time which we don't know but thankfully the guards gave as a chance to stroll & take pictures since it's our last day in Davao. Great place to stroll with the kids. Proud...More

The only thing the sets this park different from others is that there are statues which I don't know who they are and the story behind it. They're interesting to see though. The park is safe and well-maintained. There's also a place for jogging and...More
Great place to go to when its your first time in Davao, for jogging and sight-seeing. People can eat here and every sunday there is a free aerobics class everybody can attend for free!
My hotel is just in-front of the Park. So, i decided to check out. The park seems Safe, Clean and very refreshing. People are strolling and jogging.
The park is well-maintained and really beautiful at night. The place was very much secured because of the presence of the security guards. This is a good place to kill time.

Review Title: A family Dinner in the People's Park
Review: Pres. Duterte, former City Mayor in this very beautiful and peaceful place of Davao , was right when he named this beautiful and relaxing place as People's Part, for after all they money used to build this park is from the People. The children and...More

Review Title: Good place to stop and jog by!
Review: It's really a good place to jog-walk around. I like seeing people being with their love ones in the park and feeling really happy! The arts and statues in there are truly worth seeing.
A simple park yet it's one of the few parks I've learned to appreciate. Wide, lively and the feel is just sooo Davao.
We visited the park at night on our first night out. Security upon entry is very strict. Nice Durian inspired roofing. We just strolled around the park in circle.

We went there as part of our day tour in the city and was very amazed as to the cleanliness of the park. You feel really secured even if you won't see any security guards roaming around. As what my Davaoena friend said, they have...More
A short trip with friends suggest that this place is very friendly for family picnics. A little bit crowded at times but fair enough to roam around with kids.

i've seen people from all walks of life, kids, adults, senior citizens, employees, students and tourists, there's nothing special about this park except for there are lotsa people who spend time at the park
The different fiberglass life size action figures display are nice treat for kids and kids at heart. I hope it will be a permanent display

Review Title: Nice place to chill and do some laps
Review: Nice oasis in the city with lots of trees and shade. As a runner, I wish they didn't make the jogging oval made of bricks, it's harder on the body and uneven. That said, it's great to have a place to do laps in the...More

It was probably very nice at some point but seemed very run down and in disrepair as far as I could tell. The fountain doesn't work anyone, the waterfall wasn't working and many chairs were just rusted and broken accidents waiting to happen. Any history...More

Review Title: IT WAS NOT MAINTAINED WELL THAT TIME
Review: Cause I have never been to what they say the Peoples Park of Davao where people hang around and have picnics, couples who dates there and people who wants to jog on a humble place. So we went there no fees were asked which before was present. Place was packed but very dark. People were running around the circle of the park. Fountain was not around at that time which was I wanna see.

I went to peoples park a number of times throughout the year and i have to say its great. There is just something about this place that makes me smile. i love visiting this place. it can be peacful and fun

Review Title: A park within the concrete city building
Review: There are some animation going on here from time to time ... good place to breathe between a few trees!

I went early, at 6 AM, to Peeples park. It was awesome! There were at least 1500 to 2000 people doing a lot of Zumba style dance routine. What a great time to be out in the middle of a beautiful park dancing for health! There were an additional 500 circling the park on the walking track… All the time this was interspersed with the craziest fiberglass sculptures of superheroes where you could stop and get your picture taken! Wow!
Love the. Hope you will like it too. Clean. Friendly people. Theres so many activities. There is a free lugaw .

Review Title: Free Park at the heart of the city
Review: Great for walking with family or friends... There are also tables for picnic and no entrance free so that's an added plus because you can bond with your loved ones without spending much.
Roam around for free, have exercise -zumba especially in the morning, see a lot of statues, all greens and very pleasant park to walk into.

Review Title: A haven in the heart of Davao City.
Review: To the locals like me, it is the perfect place to do my morning jogs plus we get to eat free lugaw (porridge). You couldn't imagine it is in the heart of the city because the place is so peaceful. I recommend this as a must visit place for tourists. The perfect place to relax in the afternoon or early evening after exploring the different tourist spots in Davao.

This is most amazing place and i want get married there in august if i can contact whover is in charge . I met my future wife not far from there and we hope to be married in the park if we have permission in august this year

Review Title: The Greenest You Find In The City
Review: This is a perfect place to rest your tired feet from exploring the entire city. Enjoy people watching. Enjoy the fresh air. Walk fast, walk slow. Just go with flow.

Relaxing and colorful park with childrens playground. You can stroll around but you can also sit back and relax on benches watching numerous doves. We saw some people feeding doves so they were able to literally touch them. Feels like you're in Italy. You can also take photos with the colorful and life size cartoon characters. There is designated entrance and exit gates located in different sides of the park. No entrance fees but the park is quite maintained.

We went to this park on a six day vacation and tour in Davao City. This park is a good place to stroll any time during the day because of its shaded track. There are a lot of activities to engage with: picture taking with the statues, many shady trees, and a center for travel information.
within the center of Davao City. Nice place to relax with your family. Near local food stalls. Safe fro kids with oval track open as early as 7:00am

This place is for everyone! A park in the middle of Davao City where you can relax, exercise, date etc... Every early morning Sunday, if you're lucky, you can have your free pongee/porridge(lugaw).... Have a great visit in your Park...

I usually go here either to relax or exercise. The park will usually be bustling with activity in the afternoon until the evening. Lots of weird statues to look at, and also don't for get to go to the center of the park to relax and enjoy the company of trees.
a relaxing spot in the middle of the urban jungle.takes you away from the hustle and bustle of the daily city grind...

High five guys! All the good vibes are here again & to tell you honestly. This city is close to my heart of how organized, relatively beautiful & amazing it is. From our tough mayor to the warmest smiles of the locals, who would definitely capture your heart and soul in a heartbeat. Seriously, Davao City is top 1, I mean in my heart i know this is far by the best cities I've ever been. This was like my 2nd hometown & all I can say are just purely positive things. I cannot say no more. You have to see to believe.  For smokers & vapers: Davao City is strictly implementeng "No Smoking Policy in Public" so please please be aware! Don't be scared by this, I'm just nagging a lil bit like your grandma, your mom, your wife or girlfriend or just a nagging lil concerned friend. ✌️ Peace-out! :))

It was created by the City Government of Davao through the initiative of Mayor Duterte for the people of Davao. A place you can relax with family and friends. It was a PTA grounds before but now a beautiful man made forest at the heart of the City. It has no entrance so people come and go. Sculptures was made by Kublai Milan representing 10 tribes of Davao City.

People's Park can be a good place for the family to relax and hang out, especially to kids because they have lots of play areas and kids love to play and run anywhere. It's safe too and very accessible because it is located at the city center.
Peoples Park is very relaxing especially the green Pine trees and Acacia Trees.The acoustic music playing around the area also contributes to the tranquility of the park.
Not much of a park but the kids love it. There are some pirate statues to take Selfies with. That's about it

Everytime I go to this park, I never feel like I am alone because it is a very lively park, filled with simple man-made figures where you can take pictures and stuff. If you wanna enjoy a cozy afternoon with some snacks and good friends with you, people's park will absolutely give you a great atmosphere and guess what, there are also a lot of areas where you can enjoy your snacks while chattering. Very clean environment with relaxing music. No entrance fee. Just make sure you're not carrying prohibited stuff with you.

Review Title: I became a little girl again!
Review: After Museo Dabawenyo, the service driver dropped us at People's Park and again we were thinking, hmmm.. Why here? It's just full of trees.. Wrong! As we went inside we were awed to the scenic view and activities people's park has to offer. We had our pictures taken between the bamboo trees like aspiring models, posed together with Philippine eagle and tribal statue, had a relaxing and breezy moment below the bamboo trees and lastly my favorite part was feeding the pigeons!! We enjoyed every moment of it like kids

I always idmire thus place very safe , relaxing it's a nice plesure to walk around watching lots of people while enjoying what thier doing lots of youngsters some of them doing thier practice for thier activities at school it's also good for old people very relaxing , my parent having a great time when I brought them ...

Review Title: An Oases at the hear of the metropolis
Review: Very relaxing place, the rainforest add the coolness of the park, the lifesize statue. Nice place for family

The Park is more of a jogging area with several cartoon characters in the form of statues. The children will surely enjoy them. There's almost no grass, the area is mostly cemented. The surroundings are filled with dried leaves and quite filthy. The comfort room...More
a combination of ethnic art originals of davao city being a dabawenyos, a perfect nature park, best place for zumba every weekends. it's good for walking while enjoying the ambiance.

The place used to be an athletic oval playground but the city decided its too small and too crowded for such. So, they converted it into a public park and launched a contest for its name. Thus, it earned its very appropriate name "People's Park"....More

If you want to unwind visit Davao's people park, You can take pictures with Dagkong Rebulto, You can be fit also kay you can Jog or exercise. There's a lot of folk exercising evry afternoon. Clean and not so crowded. 😀
got to go in during a time that it was closed, thank you Mr. security guard. different stuff goes up during the seasons. i came in just at the end of Christmas
A small, though not uninteresting pocket park in the center of the city with so,e interesting local sculptures and comfortable seating. It's safe, and a good place to rest weary legs.
Large park in the city of Davao. A lot to see, sculptures, botanical gardens, great for early morning walks and safe. I liked it.

Review Title: A park and mini forest at the heart of the city!
Review: The place is a nature park, an amusement park, and an activity center rolled into one. It is a nature park because you would never expect to see a little forest in the heart of a bustling city like Davao City and yet in the center is a real mini forest, where one could lounge and relax. Filled with numerous statutes with which you could have your photo taken, the place is also an amusement park which will delight the young and the old alike. And finally, during weekend mornings, the park becomes an activity and sports center, where you could do some running or jogging. There is also a zumba session for those so inclined. Both are events which attracts many participants, both locals and tourists. I myself witnessed the zumba and the jogging during the Sunday morning that I visited. If only all the cities in the country would have a park such as this one, the country would definitely have a happier and healthier people.
A pleasant place to walk around worth the time.Unusual statues with plenty of great photo opportunities
My second visit to People's park and it's a very nice place to hang out.Centrally located so it can be used as a meeting point to then head out for dinner.
It's a great place....lot's of people. I went there with my family during Christmas Holiday. We went there in the afternoon but I think it's so nice when you go there at night.

Review Title: En masse family visit pre new year
Review: Very very busy, Great atmosphere. Fantastic for kids , ended up with a lot of sweaty, happy children

What I like about this place, is the big eagle at the center of the park. My family and I went to Davao last year. We enjoyed posing for pictures at the many colorful places there especially at night. The lights just add to the attraction because we went there January 1 of last year so Christmas lights abound. I like to go back there again.

Review Title: Free, Safe and Nice - A Reflection of Davao City
Review: I love it here since you can walk around with the family without having to worry about anything. Admission is free, the place is clean, nobody is allowed to smoke and you can have gatherings here. Definitely a place to visit at least once for non locals.

I jog to People's Park as early as 6am and I was surprised with a number of people doing zumba when I arrive after half an hour.   I though the zumba dance was only for gym members but after a few minutes of observing, I discreetly joined the dance, for free! The experience was really amazing as I danced together with a lot of joiners- from old to young, professionals to tourists!  Tip: Head on to People's Park as early as 5am and secure your space in front of the zumba masters so you can dance and perspire more!

Review Title: A lot people come here to see. Need to update.
Review: Good public park that displays the artworks of local artists. But needs bright lighting at night. And needs to update the landscaping
Me and my hubby have dating here. Safe place and nice to walk around. Picture-picture within the area.

If you just wanna hung around and enjoy nature this place is just right for you. You can jog every morning and enjoy nature's beauty within the city. They also have zumba every Sunday morning. Nice to burn fats and excess cholesterol in a fun...More
Clean and well maintained. It's best to go there on Saturday and Sunday morning for jogging or zumba. Their free session on weekends starts at 6:00 AM.

It is a cozy place for friends and family to stroll , even for couples. One thing I like about this place is the strict regulations that they implemented. It sure keep the place safe, neat and clean for kids and adults. And good for...More

Review Title: It is a park com on
Review: Ok park for a walk. The have a monky cage++ didnt enjoy this park this much. But with all the amsing things to do in Davao and going to this park after I've been there for 3 weeks. It just got sucked up in to...More

Review Title: Park at the middle of the city
Review: People's Park is one great park right in downtown Davao. It provides greenery in urban Davao.. a place to breathe, walk, sit and enjoy the place.

The park is fairly clean but it needs renovation (repaint chairs and sculptures), maintenance (please clean the pond, the water is murky and has a lot of moss), please remove the monkey (people are feeding it with junk), and please allow dogs inside. You can...More
The park has a good security measures. Also has a statues that depicts the heritage of Davao. It is also a nice place to jog or to simply walk around the vicinity.
I found it very relaxing, at the time I was dating my now wife and her mother and tita were with us.. we talked ahead of them

Review Title: Nice place to have a walk
Review: The place is really good for walking. It is quiet and clean. And I feel safe walking around here with my family. A must go to place in Davao.

Review Title: A quiet,clean,and beautiful park in the center of the city
Review: My wife and I spent a few hours walking around this very nice park.Very well kept and clean.This park is free to all.There are many areas for children to play and explore.Highly recommend a time there.

It was a Saturday evening and there were just some few people in the park. It was dark in most areas so we had to watch our step especially on the uneven surface. We only did some picture-taking and left as there was nothing much...More

Well maintained and free of diesel fumes. I was here almost every morning for 2 weeks. It was never too crowded even with the Saturday Zumba class. It was great to see many Dabawenyos involved in physical fitness.

Went there for a lazy Sunday afternoon and to allow my daughter to experiment if her eagle balloon can fly like a kite. We were impressed that it was free but well-kept. Amazed at how homey it feels despite it being a public park. Luscious...More

this is a small park in the middle of the city of Davao that has a bit of everything- benches to sit on, some grassy area for picnics, a playground , a bamboo grove. but strangely, there is loud music blaring at all times. kind...More
Nice place to hangout or just to jog. Well maintained, but the CR is not very clean. You see people from all walks of life. Students, family.

you would think this park is just one of the ordinary pastime places in davao. you're correct in a way but if it's your first time to visit the place, there's more to see that deserves appreciation. for one, there are several art structures that...More
Yes it is really people's park. Nice place to visit. We stayed there for almost 2 hours. The music around the park makes the place more relaxing.

Does what it says. Its a park. But not a lot of grass! Lots of concrete though... It has plenty of figures designed by local artists highlighting the city and the surrounding area, which are kinda fun. But overall, a park. If you have a...More

I love those big statues that represents Dabawenyos traditions and cultures. What strikes to me is the big Philippine Eagle sculpture near the entrance. Also the miniature of the whole DAVAO island inside is amazing. #thumbsup
Located in the middle of the city, a good place to refresh and take refuge from the city's noise and busyness.

If your travelling to understand or know how the locals go night out, try visiting People's Park on a Sunday night. We went their Sept 6 a sunday and people gathered for a Singing contest and spend time out of the house. They looked really...More

A lovely place to visit , morning , noon or night it always seems to be busy with people just walking or even doing there jogging on the large path that surrounds the park internally , plenty of shade and an hour or 2 spent...More
Have been there and it is ok la .... If have time go up to my apo to get some green - is mich better ;) is a ok option to see some local night life as many local go there...

Review Title: Family friendly park frequented by the locals.
Review: Seems like an average maintained public park. The fact that lighters, cigarettes, and food vendors are prohibited from entering contributes to an average cleanliness level. But it can be cleaner and better maintained for sure. Of course, don't expect an Ayala-ish kind of vibe from...More

The Park is situated in the heart of the city right across Casa Leticia at the corners of Jose Camus and J. Palma Gil streets, and is a walking distance from Apo View Hotel, Mandaya Hotel, shopping malls, restaurants, bars, coffee shops, commercial establishments, and...More

Davaoeños was so excited when this park open. It is good for family picnic. Recommend to visit this place at night to see the fountain show and the beautiful lights inside. There is no entrance fee in entering this park so go and enjoy.
conveniently located park a quiet oasis in a noisy city, within a noisy city the park is convenient X
People's park is a great place for friends and families to visit. You can see a lot of artworks that the city is proud of.

Review Title: Forest at the heart of the city
Review: I jog here often and we gather groups here even students tend to make this park a practice area so I would rate this place excellent because its free and maintained. Come and visit because some history is also told in some parts of the...More

Review Title: Family weekend getaway in the middle of the city
Review: This is one of the most affordable places to visit with the whole family. Kids will enjoy the play park, and the scenery is great for picture taking. This place has been developed for the whole family.

I liked the idea of putting structures of little brown men, artificial plants, etc, and the diversity of the place. It is also quite wide and there are actually birds walking on the road, giving you a 'nature' feel. Also, I can see that this place is one way of getting together without the cost of paying the venue. Hmm. It's just a shame that they have some sort of opening and closing 'time'.
Very nice park with some great sights to see. The statues are fun to pose with and it is kept clean and tidy.
Just an ordinary park. If you want to kill your time, you better watch a movie than staying at this park.

Very romantic park, I must say! My husband and I personally loved the idea of a nature park in the city center. We checked in to a hotel in front and we wanted a breath of fresh air, so we went outside and found this really nice park. You can just walk or jog around it. Eat ice cream and just enjoy being a kid once again. It's really wide and spacious. It's a must see if ever you visit Davao. And don't forget to take a lot of pictures. Make memories...it's forever...

Review Title: It's a breath of fresh air
Review: You can jog, walk around man-made forest replicas of major forests in the world. This I think is the lung of the Davao City center because of the green environment. A perfect place to hang around with friends and families at no cost. Try feeding the pigeons not with junk food. You can bring pellets for the birds to have healthier meals ;)

We are about to go to Pasalubong Center when we got here, but sadly, it was closed yet. We were too early (9:30AM) for the opening. I would love to take a tour to this place and make my review but I guess it will not happen yet.   I will be making my review here once I am able to and to go back to Davao. :)   I can say and perhaps it can be compared to Nayong Pilipino in Manila? Anyway, one way to find out is to get here. :)

Review Title: Spacious public park in the city center.
Review: When in Davao, be sure to drop by this park. It's a testament of how clean and green Davao City is. There are also nice restaurants nearby where you can eat local food.
Park, plaza, picnic area... a place where you can relax, have fun, be you, and enjoy the fresh air and the beauty of nature in park.
I've been a constant visitor of people's park every time my family is in Davao City, usually twice a year. it's beautiful, clean and a perfect place for family bonding!

Review Title: A very clean and relaxing place
Review: We went there last saturday. The place was so beautiful and clean. They really maintain the cleanliness of the park. And there are securities who will check your things before going in. You will feel so safe during your stay there. And i never saw...More

Review Title: you've never been to Davao if you've not visited this
Review: Forest in the midst of the city. BEAUTIFUL. A place where you can breathe fresh air in an urban place. Good for personal, group and lovers' time to bond with all its amenities. You will get a glimpse of what is Davao.

I always remember this park when the City government of Davao invited Dabawenyos in their "name-this-park" campaign. It was the time when Mayor Duterte has beautified this once "PTA grounds" into a park. If I have joined the campaign I could have submitted the park...More

Review Title: Nice place to relax in Davao... Just wear mosquito repellant !
Review: Visited Peoples park in the heart of Davao, the trees make it a nice sheltered place away from the heat of the city. Still havent figured out what all the odd statues are? The area is full of people walking, jogging or just relaxing ....More

Review Title: Breather in the middle of an urban
Review: Benches underneath a bunch of trees... The park is clean actually it is well maintained. A must see to anyone who are in davao
a good place to stay.. with out any expenditure ... place is soo cool clean and have benches to sit.

Review Title: go here at night.its the best
Review: during the day its to hot and you will see all the imperfections. At night is the most fun, you will see a lot of different people here. the always gave a nice photo expo. mind it, this is more an asian park than a...More

This is a piece of paradise in Davao. Ideal for families, friends, lovers , and even for solitary refection. Davao city is blessed to have this huge expanse of flora and fauna. Best place to jog in the city !
Well maintained park and very safe. Security checks before entering makes all those who enter feel safe. The place is good for picture taking as well as excellent place to walk, jog or run.
best to hang out with family & friends to do almost anything under the sun...or night! good to see and have a snap with the big sculptures of indigenous people...

Just to stroll around or lounge in this park is a great experience I visited in November 2014 and hearing the Christmas music playing was wonderful. Young couples parents with kids older couples everyone seemed to enjoy being there just to walk to feed the...More

A nice park smack bang in the middle of the city. It's open for a few hours early int he morning for joggers, then closes. opens again in the afternoon and early evening. Nice for a walk, or a jog if you are so inclined.
Nice park with free zumba. I like the nice sculpture. Kublai Millan is a former highschool classmate and nice to know he designed the sculptures here.
the Mayor really knows how to maintain cleanliness here :) has a lot of activity spots, from doing a regular stroll around the area or enjoying yourself in semi botanical garden within the busy city.

Loved the figures everywhere! we had fun taking pictures of each and every statue there. the central area where benches are beneath the trees is very romantic. we even noticed a couple having their pre-nup pictorial there!

Nice public space, more grass and less concrete would be nice. Needs maintenance, especially the concrete characters need repainting. The poor monkey going round and round in a small cage deserves better accomodation.
I have been in the park several times - sad to say, even after several years after its opening - there is nothing very special. Strolling around, sitting on the benches ... that's it.
Excellent place for just some plain strolling or a good jog around the place or just sitting around in the benches.
beautiful,quiet not really big park. Had a nice walk, and in the weekends you can go for a public zumba at morning
if you'll visit people's park do it during the night. well lighted. and don't worry about the safety of davao, it is number 4 in the safest city in the world.

Review Title: it;s ok but really not a park per say

very nice little park where you can hide from the bedlam just outside the fence line shame they had to demolish a football field to get it in

Review Title: Small Park with a Small Fee
Review: A single visit is worth it unless there are new things. Very accessible and entrance has a small fee. Do not be too excited in visiting here. Keep you expectation low but a visit is a must.
If you visit Davao city you should take a look here. Not much to do, but beautiful. And the Filipino Eagle are very BIG :) But don´t bring bottles inside, because it makes guards crazy.

Review Title: Nice Park in the middle of Davao City
Review: This is an open park in the center of Davao City. It has walking paths and statues with grassy areas to sit down and relax. Lot's of kids here as it is a good spot for them to run around and play.

You need to relax? You wish to be far away from the city's loud voice? Yeah, here it's indeed quiet and peaceful - and the most important: well-maintained. I miss this in many other places around Davao City. "Sayang".

The park is a place were we really enjoy the experience of having Zumba in a bigger and wider area . I am one of those who constantly visit during weekends, and in this place I can unwind and sweat a lot to the beat....More
The park is quiet and peaceful with lots of space to unwind. Clean, well-maintained and located just at the heart of the city.

The park is very wide and the Kublai pieces the best attractions. You can bring food and eat in the benches or set a blanket in the inner of the oval. Children enjoyed watching the fishes in the pond (though it's quite murky now than...More
nice place to relax or jog. many place to set and talk a while.clean but many delapadated,shall i say things which is an eye sore.the eagle statue is wonderfull.

The name speaks for itself. This place is secured, a trademark of Davao, I guess. The place is clean. Not really that much of a tourist attraction but if you have time to spare, visiting People's Park is not really a bad choice. Plus, it...More
in the middle of the city. filled with larger than life sculptures of local life, centered by a huge likeness of the local favorite fruit: durian. always a pleasure to take a walk there

Location: General Santos City, General Santos, Philippines
Review: There were many people, vendors, and it has a clean place because their mayor is really implementing the rules but be careful with pickpockets because you may go home crying.

Review Title: The Safest Park in the Philippines
Review: I like this park because it is Free, clean, open, well-guarded and plenty of place to sit around. I went here alone and tried to look at it as an adult and as a child. I think Families will enjoy this park. There are whimsical...More
Beautiful park with lots of local art and statues. Great place to people watch, enjoy a picnic, walk off a big meal or even use the jogging track. Very safe!

Unless you go for a jog, you can be in and out within 30 minutes. I think people are exaggerating the park's cleanliness and landscaping. I don't mean to offend Filipinos, but this park is noteworthy only by Philippine standards. But to Westerners, it's just...More

Review Title: not much too see, dancing fountain wasnt really something to check out
Review: and the dancing fountain isnt much vigan have a better dancing fountain might be good for families with kids and lovers who prefers the dark, as the place is not well lighted
No water falls, everything was closed. several subjects lifting weights next to the Garden area that had no flowers.

stayed for 4 hours..waiting for other delegates since the bus going to samal was near here. we had our lunch here and the food is quiet expensive and doesnt taste well..outside there are durian stalls.. and sad is some gives us prices way too hugh...More

Place to stay for a while and CHILL! this was the Luneta Park residing in Davao. me and my boyfriend made some flying creatures eat piattos :) hahaha
This place is free and lots of family come to stroll, picnic and play. The park is centrally located close to the downtown area. There are lots of trees really a nice park. We love it here.

Review Title: A haven for park lovers within the city
Review: I make it a point to drop by the People's Park whenever I'm in Davao City. After long walks within the city proper, I find my way to this place to unwind and observe the locals. When you go here, make sure you don't bring...More

i like it because it is a goop place to be refreshed and hear the rushing waters and children's laughter in the middle of a busy city. it's located close to hotels, malls, government offices, schools, and even churches. it doesnt offer much activities but...More

Review Title: Great place to jog in the early AM
Review: Hundreds of people out every morning. Exercises let on Sat & Sun. Am happy my hotel was a few blocks away....no sleeping after 5:30AM close to the park....
The park in the evening is a hung-out for the locals,lovers,students and anyone who wish to have some peace of mind.It is clean and safe.Bars & restaurant are just nearby.Nothing but a park !
Nothing much to see and very hot on a summer afternoon. Glad we didn't have to pay an entrance fee. They let us in outside of the usual park hours since we weren't from Davao.

The park is decent, and popular, the area around it has some decent food and nightlife. They keep it clean and safe so give it a stroll, then find some diner nearby and then head out for some music all within blocks of here.

Seems like a place for people to take evening walks, do group exercises and just sit around to enjoy the night. There is a security check upon entering just for general safety checks. If you stay late enough you can catch the lighted fountain display...More

People's park is one of the hang outs spots in Davao City, Most people go during afternoon and evening to spend quality time with friends and family, Some do their running in the oval track (500m) of the park early morning especially during Saturday and...More

it was night when we strolled the park and security upon entering the premises was so tight. we have to queue for the inspection of our bags. but the wait is worth it because you will truly appreciate the park.it was a wide park and...More

Review Title: Not Much to Miss - Visit if You Can
Review: People's Park is located in downtown Davao. Entrance is free, and it's a good place to visit if you have time. There''s not much in it, but it's got these nice statues made by a local artist and I think foreign tourists would love to...More
A beautiful park in the midst of the city. Beautiful scenery, and walking, running paths. Well secured, NO CRIME!

Review Title: Good family place but a busy park
Review: I cannot remember when I really went there but there was a lot of teens and college students even at night. But I think this will be a good place for the family on weekends. Clean and lots of spaces where can just bond with the little kids.
A place you can enjoy a nice walk. You can also see some sculptures there. A very safe environment day or night.

For a public park that is free, I would say that it is an excellent park because it is clean. It also has lots of wonderful sculptures. The security is also strict which is really a good thing. The park is a very relaxing place. The park is also surrounded with restaurants so food is not a problem.

Review Title: Quick break in the heart of the city
Review: Consider it as Davao's lungs. The patches of green make you feel relax and forget that ur in the middle of an urban center. Great for walks and jogs in early mornings and late afternoons, or simply a place to stroll and chat with friends. Tip: free aerobic/Zumba exercises on weekends!
I enjoyed the park because of the bautiful artwork of smilling kids. and I also enjoyed the doves that are living in that park, they come close to me.hehehe

Review Title: Worth a look if you have time
Review: It's a little park basically with some areas that are ok for photos. There's no adventure or glamour and it's a hang out for Davao residents.   I walked through there once and it was pleasant.   I don't know that it would be too exciting for foreign visitors whereby Samal, Jack's Ridge, Crocodile Park would be ahead on that list.

Review Title: Thumbs up for a public park
Review: The park is clean and it is no smoking. You can definitely enjoy your time if you have kids. The sculptures are a real work of art.

Before you enter the park policemen will inspect your bags and other belongs for security reasons.The place is well kept.The trees are well groomed.The park is clean and has nice looking statues.Its a good place to rest after rooming around the city.Be sure to take pictures.
Ponds, gardens and stone sculpture. Pastoral. Restful. The restaurants are just outside the complex.

One of the most accessible and nicest places to visit in Davao. Once you enter the park you'll see curious-looking statues and kids running around and visitors taking pictures. The place has a warm and friendly atmosphere that invites everyone in. It's not unusual to...More
easy to find it and well kept...and they have toilets so convenient. They are also careful so there"s a security check at the gates....

People's Park is a place made for kids. It has sculptures and lots for them to see and do. It is located in the city so you can stop there for a walk or to relax. The statues are created by the famous artist Kublai....More

The best thing about this park is that it is in middle of Davao - an oasis in a crowded, congested city. there are plenty of activities for kids. As well, there are wonderful statues to see created by Kublai, the guru-artist of Davao. I'd...More

Review Title: You shouldn't miss when in Davao
Review: I submit to the artists' excellence in the different sculptures dominating the park. The park not only offer a relaxing place and playground for children but also offers a showcase of Filipino masterpieces. We arrived at the park around 10am. We were told that the...More

Definitely, one of the city government's greatest projects. This showcase the sculpture of Davao's best artist--- Kublai Millan.. Other than the city's people's park, he has created sculpture in most cities and municipalities of Mindanao.. Also, the place is preserved and is secured by government...More

Review Title: safe and clean -- even at night!
Review: this is the one park i've been to where you have street sweepers and park rangers up and about at around 8p.m. it was very safe, clean and brightly lit. i just chilled by the bench watching people jog around. it's a nice place to...More

Review Title: One of the Best Parks in the Country
Review: This for me is truly one of the best parks in the country. They also give priority to visiting tourists even if they are closed for the usual rounds of cleaning. What I also love about this park is the huge eagle sculpture that accurately represents Davao for being the City that preserves the Philippine Eagle. This park also houses locals who are into their dance routines and exercises. A must visit when you are in Davao.

Way back last 4 years ago when our class going to Davao city, we visited this kind of Park.. I will say, this one of the best Park of the country.. A lot of things that your eyes will enjoyed to see.. also there is mini zoo and falls that man made.. i will definitely come here again when i going back to davao..... :-)

Review Title: Very nice Park in middle of city
Review: The People's Park is a must see if you are in Davao.It's a very large city block ,or larger, gated park. You have to go through security-no weapons or cigarettes as Davao is pretty much smoke free. The park has a circular walk along the perimeter with ponds, waterfalls, a large collection of different trees from all over asia and a sitting area and water show (some nights). During Christmas season they have a synchronized light and music and water show. It also has a kids play area. Very nice to stroll around in the evening with plenty of good restaurants nearby.
People`s Park is within the city proper. One can sit and relax and enjoy the weather. Its for free so no need to worry about expenses.
nothing much to see, except food vendors, the park is over rated, nothing exciting, foods sold by vendors are mostly junk foods.
what surprised me in this park is that it has...bag inspection before you enter. :) the park is okay; it's not that big. it has man-made waterfalls

Review Title: A nice place for people with limited funds
Review: I do think its worth visiting but more for the learning about Davao and its citizen than for the place itself. Toilets are really nasty, but the park has value as a relaxing place where people from all classes can meet. There is no fee´s

It’s a small but interesting park in the center of Davao City, Entry is free but everyone is security searched on entry. Lots of trees, quiet areas and places for children to play. There are also lots of larger than life painted sculptures by the renowned Davao artist and Kublai Millan.

Review Title: Lively place for a morning jaunt
Review: I happen to rent a room very near the People's Park. It is such a hive of activities on Saturdays and Sundays. There is an aerobic session which has 300 people dancing and enjoying themselves.  It is quite small for a green lung in the city but you feel relatively safe. It is constant full of people, the security is pretty tight. The amenities are wanting, the toilets need to be maintained better.

It's new! Did not realize this existed in the heart of Davao. There were plenty of areas that friends can just wander around, lovers to cozy up to each other whispering sweet nothings. Security checks each person entering the premises. Secure.

Review Title: Speaks for the rich culture of Davaoenos
Review: Clean, Forest in the city, and wonderful art work of famous kublai can be seen in this place, playground that would kids surely njoy for free, plenty of seats that relax your mine and have some snacks while seeing plenty of visitors use to walk around, lovely music everywhere, and the most important is very safe, police visibility in area,no smoking, tight security check upon entrance makes everyone to feel more comfortable during their visit. Bringing of food is allowed but no sharp or deadly weapons allowed, and clean your own mess as courtesy to the next user and to the mgt of the park as this park is free of entrance and all amenities so let's be responsible and sensitive while you visit here.

Review Title: Great place to be, safe and relaxing
Review: A clean and pleasantly beautiful place for everyone.  There is a scheduled opening time and this make sure that the park is cleaned and readied for the next batch to come in the later afternoon. Everyone feels safe. The guards checked whoever comes in.  Beautiful place. Be sure to bring your camera
The park is located beside the Apo View Hotel and open till nightime. It is free of charge and offers the public a view of amazing and wonderful display of artworks and sculptures.

Review Title: good location for a family get together
Review: the place is child friendly this is the cheapest place to stay with the family and have adry picninc there

A forest in the City does exists? Yes, it does! The People's Park in Davao City is a forest in the city where you can enjoy to take a look at if you are a tourist in Davao. The different varieties of growing trees which will give shades when you stroll the area, the artificial waterfalls will enchant you to take a picture. And if you get tired of strolling around, the benches are all over waiting for you to take a rest, enjoy the scenery and see the locals enjoying the park's view as well. You can also have a picnic there, just ensure to bring your own and that you clean up your mess and throw it properly in the garbage bins visible within the park. The place is free for everyone :)

I am living 100 meters away from this park. And i could say that this is the perfect place for me to jog. Spent 30 to 60minutes twice a week here. Sadly, the park will open 5:00am everyday. I will give EXCELLENT rating if they will open the gate at 4:00am.
yes and you will enjoy as there many people jogging in this place. they open early so convenient and clean...oh got clean rest room as well

it could be me-- but the People's pPark in Davao has just the right combo of tackiness and fun to make it a great place to go on a family outing. I was there alone and without family, but seeing the oversized statues, the families...More
it was the first ever park i when in to with guard who will ask for an identification card and check your bags. the place was clean and peaceful.
nice place, nice security, nice music, everyone can definitely enjoy the place, but nothing spectacular really
Visited the park before I go back to Cebu last Sunday. It is very clean and it's a nice place to sit down and talk with your friends and take some pictures :P
I thought it was just like any other ordinary park here in Manila. But it's not. It's bigger, nicer and more entertaining. They have statues, waterfalls, nice lights. Great place to unwind.
The best city park I have seen in the Philippines decorated with Kublai Milan's cute statues. Dont miss to visit it !

Review Title: Free for all, just mind the opening hours!
Review: This park is nice, with larger than life statues, a great place to hang around with friends. Mind the opening hours which are strange.. they are written on the fence.. something like 5am-9am and 9pm-midnight. If you get stuck outside there's some pretty good Ihaw-Ihaws...More
This so called park has nothing in common we the "western" definition of a park. No good place to relax at all.

Review Title: An oasis in a busy city.
Review: Quite a unique place. I love the local wooden figures. There are some great flowers & plants. It is an oasis in a busy city.
Safe and clean! Great way to spend a sunny breezy afternoon with a loved one. Too bad it rained when we visited the place!
Peaceful, beautiful, quiet all describe this park in the middle of a busy city. Many people attending, but so spacious that never feel crowded.
No entrance fee and the place's full of arts showing Davao's culture. The best part is you can feed the pigeons with Fita or Eggnog. That alone is so relaxing and fun!
it was very clean and well maintained. there are lots of statues that you could take pics of or you could just relax and go people-watching. nice place to while the time..
close to where we stay... nice place for jogging, clean restrooms and i feel safe inside

One of the cleanest and greenest park I've ever visit, no entrance fee yet with security guard and person in-charge maintaining the park's cleanliness. There, you have views to take your pictures, you'll really enjoy. We have so fun in there.

Review Title: huge park in a circle shape
Review: a non smoking park, local can do aerobics and jogging inside the park..playground is safe for the children. and pigeons flying free inside the park..

Review Title: Nice place for couples and picture taking.
Review: I like the access to it, even tho it opens a little late in the day.
You can take many great photos, it's a great place to hang-out with your friends and family. And it's free!

Davao trip is not complete if you miss visiting their People's Park. It is a park in the center of the city. A good place to stroll with family on Saturdays and Sundays. They have gardens with gazebos where you could enjoy your simple picnic...More
Well, the park was quite ordinary. It didn't really have the wow factor.

Review Title: Aptly named: People's Park in Davao City:)
Review: Look, anywhere the city government maintains a "beautified" park for the enjoyment of residents and visitors alike, get an A+ grade from me:) Just take note of the park's schedule I attached here before you go. By the way, you are NOT allowed to bring...More

this park is big and i enjoyed my strolling time here. we went here after our dinner at fridays and walikng around here helps us to loose our dinner..theres a lot to see here and my frendz and were having fun about the statues.. outside...More

Review Title: Relaxing place in the heart of the city
Review: Though I have been to Davao many times but I never visited that place except for my last visit because a friend of mine insisted. The park was a child friendly. I love the rainbow color of the floor when you reach entrance. The sculpture of eagles and children playing was nice. People there, loved to sit and listen to the music played in the park.   They are strict with their security. You can't bring bottled water or a cigarette, lighter. You must leave it at the entrance and claim it when you decide to leave the park. Well, someone who is new to Davao must visit this place. Its just around the downtown, near to the restaurants and hospitals.
